org.activebpel.rt.bpel.def.validation.expr
Interface IAeExpressionValidator

All Known Implementing Classes:
AeAbstractExpressionValidator, AeNoOpExpressionValidator
public interface IAeExpressionValidator

This interface defines a common API for classes that validate expressions. The BPEL 1.0 default expression language is XPath 1.0, so there will be at least one class that implements this interface (AeXPathExpressionValidator).

Method Summary
 IAeExpressionValidationResult validateBooleanExpression(IAeExpressionValidationContext aContext, java.lang.String aExpression)
          This method is called to validate an expression that is expected to return a Boolean.
 IAeExpressionValidationResult validateDeadlineExpression(IAeExpressionValidationContext aContext, java.lang.String aExpression)
          This method is called to validate an expression that is expected to return a deadline.
 IAeExpressionValidationResult validateDurationExpression(IAeExpressionValidationContext aContext, java.lang.String aExpression)
          This method is called to validate an expression that is expected to return a duration.
 IAeExpressionValidationResult validateExpression(IAeExpressionValidationContext aContext, java.lang.String aExpression)
          This method is called to validate a generic expression.
 IAeExpressionValidationResult validateJoinConditionExpression(IAeExpressionValidationContext aContext, java.lang.String aExpression)
          This method is called to validate a join condition expression.
 IAeExpressionValidationResult validateUnsignedIntExpression(IAeExpressionValidationContext aContext, java.lang.String aExpression)
          This method is called to validate an expression that is expected to return an unsignedInt.
 

Method Detail

validateExpression

public IAeExpressionValidationResult validateExpression(IAeExpressionValidationContext aContext,
                                                        java.lang.String aExpression)
                                                 throws AeException
This method is called to validate a generic expression. It returns a IAeExpressionValidationResult that will be interrogated for the result of the validation. This method should throw an exception only for errors that it did not expect to find. It should, however, internally handle the case where the expression syntax is invalid.

Parameters:
aContext - The expression validation context
aExpression - The expression to validate.
Throws:
AeException

validateBooleanExpression

public IAeExpressionValidationResult validateBooleanExpression(IAeExpressionValidationContext aContext,
                                                               java.lang.String aExpression)
                                                        throws AeException
This method is called to validate an expression that is expected to return a Boolean. The class implementing this interface (which will be expression language specific) can then provide additional logic (when possible) to determine if the expression is a valid boolean expression. It is expected that some languages may not be able to do any type checking at validation (untyped or dynamically typed languages, for example). Such languages should simply do generic expression validation in that case.

Parameters:
aContext - The expression validation context
aExpression -
Throws:
AeException

validateJoinConditionExpression

public IAeExpressionValidationResult validateJoinConditionExpression(IAeExpressionValidationContext aContext,
                                                                     java.lang.String aExpression)
                                                              throws AeException
This method is called to validate a join condition expression. Join conditions are subject to a set of relatively strict rules. For example, only boolean operators and the bpws:getLinkStatus() function may be used in the expression. In addition, the result must be a Boolean. Please refer to the BPEL specification for more details.

Parameters:
aContext - The expression validation context
aExpression -
Throws:
AeException

validateUnsignedIntExpression

public IAeExpressionValidationResult validateUnsignedIntExpression(IAeExpressionValidationContext aContext,
                                                                   java.lang.String aExpression)
                                                            throws AeException
This method is called to validate an expression that is expected to return an unsignedInt. The class implementing this interface (which will be expression language specific) can then provide additional logic (when possible) to determine if the expression is a valid unsignedInt expression. It is expected that some languages may not be able to do any type checking at validation (untyped or dynamically typed languages, for example). Such languages should simply do generic expression validation in that case.

Parameters:
aContext - The expression validation context
aExpression -
Throws:
AeException
